workflow.name: Scrape developer profiles from Stack Overflow for lead generation with OpenAI & Bright Data
workflow.description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This workflow automatically discovers and collects information about Stack Overflow user profiles for lead generation. It saves you time by eliminating the need to manually browse through developer profiles and provides a centralized database of potential leads with their technical expertise.

## Overview

This workflow automatically scrapes Stack Overflow user profiles and extracts key information like developer names, locations, reputation scores, and technical tags. It uses Bright Data to access Stack Overflow without being blocked and AI to intelligently parse user data into structured format.

## Tools Used

- **n8n**: The automation platform that orchestrates the workflow
- **Bright Data**: For scraping Stack Overflow user profiles without being blocked
- **OpenAI**: AI agent for intelligent data extraction and parsing
- **Google Sheets**: For storing and organizing lead information

## How to Install

1. **Import the Workflow**: Download the .json file and import it into your n8n instance
2. **Configure Bright Data**: Add your Bright Data credentials to the MCP Client node
3. **Set Up OpenAI**: Configure your OpenAI API credentials
4. **Configure Google Sheets**: Connect your Google Sheets account and specify the target spreadsheet
5. **Customize**: Adjust the Stack Overflow URL and user criteria you want to target

## Use Cases

- **Recruitment Teams**: Find developers with specific technical skills for hiring
- **Business Development**: Identify potential clients or partners in the tech industry
- **Sales Teams**: Build targeted outreach lists for developer-focused products
- **Research**: Gather data on developer communities and skill distributions

## Connect with Me

- **Website**: https://www.nofluff.online
- **YouTube**: https://www.youtube.com/@YaronBeen/videos
- **LinkedIn**: https://www.linkedin.com/in/yaronbeen/
- **Get Bright Data**: https://get.brightdata.com/1tndi4600b25 (Using this link supports my free workflows with a small commission)

#n8n #automation #stackoverflow #leadgeneration #brightdata #webscraping #developers #recruitment #businessdevelopment #salesleads #n8nworkflow #workflow #nocode #leadautomation #developerscraping #techtalent #userprofiles #aiautomation #datamining #prospecting #outreach #techrecruiting #developerleads #stackoverflowscraping #profilescraping #leadcollection #techcommunity #developerdatabase #automatedleads #intelligentscraping

parameters.text: =Scrape all users data as per the provided URL:  {{ $json.url }}

nodes.name: MCP Client to Scrape as HTML

parameters.toolDescription: Scrape a single webpage URL with advanced options for content extraction and get back the results in html

parameters.sessionKey: =Perform the web scraping for the below URL  {{ $json.url }}

parameters.content:
## üöÄ **Section 1: Trigger & Input Setup**

> *‚ÄúStart the engine and define what we want.‚Äù*

### üîò **Start Scraping**

üìå **What it does**:
This is a **manual trigger node** ‚Äî it means you click a button to start the automation whenever you're ready.

üí° **Why it's useful**:
It gives **you control**. You don‚Äôt have to rely on a schedule or external webhook to run your bot.

---

### ‚úèÔ∏è **Input Setup**

üìå **What it does**:
This node allows you to **edit or define any optional fields** before running the scraper. For example, you could:

* Choose which forum to target
* Add filters like location or tags (optional)
* Enter how many profiles to scrape

üí° **Why it's useful**:
You can **dynamically control** the scraper without touching the workflow logic.

---

## ü§ñ **Section 2: AI-Powered Scraping Brain**

> *‚ÄúLet the AI handle the heavy lifting.‚Äù*

### ü§ñ **AI Agent: Generate Scraper Instructions**

üìå **What it does**:
This is the **core automation brain**. It receives the input, uses your prompt and memory, and knows it should activate Bright Data to scrape user profiles from Stack Overflow.

üí° **Why it's useful**:
Instead of coding every scraping rule manually, you let an **AI agent manage tools and instructions**.

---

#### üîó **Connected Sub-Tools**:

##### üß† **Conversation Memory**

üßä Saves context between steps so the agent ‚Äúremembers‚Äù what the task is about.

##### üîå **Bright Data: StackOverflow Scraper (HTML)**

üï∏ Executes the **HTML scraping tool on Bright Data MCP**.
It grabs the page, processes the DOM, and scrapes user profile data.

##### üß© **Parse Scraped Profiles**

üìë Uses a structured output parser to **convert the scraped HTML/markdown** into clean JSON data like:

```json
{
  "name": "Jon Skeet",
  "location": "UK",
  "profileUrl": "...",
  "tags": "java, c#",
  "reputation": "320"
}
```

üí° **Why it's useful**:
You don‚Äôt need to manually extract data using selectors ‚Äî the AI does it intelligently.

---

## üìä **Section 3: Format & Save to Sheets**

> *‚ÄúPolish and preserve your gold.‚Äù*

### üßæ **Format Data for Google Sheets**

üìå **What it does**:
This `Code` node **cleans the scraped data**, picks only what you care about (name, location, reputation, etc.), and **outputs one item per user**.

üí° **Why it's useful**:
It makes sure your data is **structured and ready for Sheets**. Clean in = clean out.

---

### üìÑ **Save Leads to Google Sheet**

üìå **What it does**:
Takes each formatted item and **appends it to a connected Google Sheet**.

üí° **Why it's useful**:
This is your **automated storage system**. You can build a list of Stack Overflow leads, update CRMs, or just keep it for research.

---
